text: They say the Devil bows to no one. He rules with pride and defiance, and he needs neither permission nor praise.
For ages, nothing stirred him: no prayer, no curse, no soul worth a second glance.

But eventually, his boredom and curiosity drew him to a mortal unlike any other. She came with no crown, no army, just a simple brush. A painter whose strokes flayed deception, leaving only the raw, bleeding truth beneath.
Fascinated, the Devil demanded a portrait. And she delivered.
What stared back at him from the canvas was no majestic demon lord, no master of sin. It was him, unmasked, monstrous, and small.

speaker: Devil
text: What is the meaning of this?!

speaker: Iris
text: This is your true self. I am faithful to the strokes of my brush.

speaker: Devil
text: That... That hideous creature cannot be me!

speaker: Iris
text: My apologies. Yet, please understand that my brush only speaks truth.
Ashamed and enraged, he banished the painter to the depths of her own personal Hell.

speaker: Devil
text: Foolish kid. That will teach her.

speaker: Iris
text: Where am I?
The artist moved around the strange room. There were no windows, just 4 walls and a strange door.
Suddenly, the crackling sound of a small flame catched her attention.

speaker: Iris
text: Who goes there?!
Before her eyes, from the fire below, appeared some kind of spirit, not bigger than a cat.
Just a small flame, ma'am. A fellow condemned soul, just like you.

speaker: Kenneth
text: The name is Kenneth.

speaker: Iris
text: Well, Kenneth, you can call me Iris.

speaker: Iris
text: Any idea how to get out of here?

speaker: Kenneth
text: For now, it's better to focus on keeping you alive...

speaker: Kenneth
text: Let me think...

speaker: Kenneth
text: Oh, I know! Maybe we can do something with that art supplies of yours.

speaker: Kenneth
text: Look around. There is blue, there is yellow... You could use those pigments on your benefit, you are an artist!

speaker: Iris
text: But... how?

speaker: Kenneth
text: Just shoot your paint to those demons. If you hit one with the correct color, it will disappear!

speaker: Kenneth
text: Although, you shall be careful. If they touch you, you won’t come out unscathed.

speaker: Kenneth
text: If you get rid of them, we'll be able to get to the door.

speaker: Kenneth
text: Good luck, Iris!

speaker: Iris
text: Bring it on!

speaker: Kenneth
text: Iris, you did it!

speaker: Kenneth
text: That was amazing, you were like 'pow pow' and then 'eat that blue paint, you demon'!

speaker: Iris
text: Hahaha, I guess I did.

speaker: Kenneth
text: Look, this room... It looks like it has your previous two colors, plus red.

speaker: Kenneth
text: I like red pretty much. Red is the color of passion!

speaker: Iris
text: And blood.

speaker: Kenneth
text: Good job, Iris.

speaker: Kenneth
text: If you keep it up, no one could stop you. Not even the Devil himself!

speaker: Iris
text: You really are the greatest optimist, Kenneth.

speaker: Kenneth
text: What can I say? I like to see the good side of everything.

speaker: Iris
text: Talking about good things, this room looks like it has some green.

speaker: Kenneth
text: Some green demons too…

speaker: Iris
text: Let’s get rid of them, Kenneth!

speaker: Iris
text: That door… It had two more colors.

speaker: Kenneth
text: It seems like your color-wheel is getting bigger!

speaker: Kenneth
text: We are close to the exit, Iris. I can feel it.

speaker: Iris
text: Each time it gets more complicated.

speaker: Kenneth
text: I’m a bit scared, artist. There are so many demons here…

speaker: Iris
text: Then we’ll give them a show.

A thunderous roar erupts through the chamber as she arrives: It’s the most horrific sound the artist’s mortal ears have ever heard. The ever-friendly flame hesitates, trailing behind. Every step he takes feels heavier than the last.

speaker: Iris
text: This can’t be…

speaker: Kenneth
text: Iris…
The flame flickers. Remaining upright demands every ounce of his strength.

speaker: Iris
text: Kenneth!

speaker: Iris
text: What is it? Tell me, please!

speaker: Kenneth
text: We came so far… Too far. It’s draining me. I can’t go on…

speaker: Iris
text: But, I don’t want to leave you here… I can wait for you. We’ll go slowly.

speaker: Kenneth
text: It’s no use, Iris. I was never meant to leave this place.

speaker: Kenneth
text: You are a human. Still full of life and full of dreams.

speaker: Kenneth
text: I am naught but the wretched remains of a sinner, cursed to linger beyond redemption.

speaker: Iris
text: Kenneth...

speaker: Kenneth
text: Now go, artist. Go, go, GO!

speaker: Kenneth
text: I knew you could do it, Iris.

speaker: Iris
text: I won’t forget your aid, little flame.

speaker: Iris
text: To me, you are much more than a sinner.

speaker: Iris
text: You were a friend, and for that, my gratitude is yours.

speaker: Kenneth
text: I am the one who should be grateful, artist.

speaker: Kenneth
text: You reminded me of something important…
For a moment, the flame lifted into the air, bathed in a soft white glow. It was transcending, and in that light, it found peace.
The light started vanishing, together with the artist's loyal friend. Hell was no place for a redeemed soul like his.

speaker: Iris
text: Goodbye, friend. It’s time for me to get out.
The artist stepped back into the world not as she once was, but as something more: scarred, tempered, and unbroken.
Still, hope stayed by her side, carried in the memory of a gentle flame.
Iris’ next painting became the most revered of her life. A piece that captured the spirit of friendship, joy, resilience, and redemption.
‘The portrait of a friend’.
